intro: Bartschella insularis, commonly known as the island bartschella, is a flowering plant native to specific island environments. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes many aromatic herbs and vegetables. The plant is characterized by its slender, branched stems and small, greenish-white flowers. It typically grows in moist, shaded areas and is adapted to coastal or island climates. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species in its native habitat.
